newsitem.title: UK: Eurobonds see St Petersburg debut, Argentina in st.
newsitem.headline: Eurobonds see St Petersburg debut, Argentina in st.

text.p: An active day in the Eurobond market saw a couple of benchmark transactions, one from Eastern Europe and the other from Latin America.
The City of St Petersburg launched its first Eurobond which was oversubscribed following extensive investor presentations across Asia, Europe and the U.S
The $300 million five-year bond was priced to yield 312.5 basis points over U.S. Treasury notes and pays a coupon of 9.50 percent.

"The purpose of this issue is to refinance with longer maturity and lower cost a portion of the City's domestic Rouble short-term debt," lead manager for the transaction Salomon Brothers said in a statement.
Argentina launched its second sterling-denominated Eurobond which saw strong British institutional demand and was oversubscribed, syndicate officials said.
The 200 million stg 10-year Eurobond was priced to yield 280 basis points over gilts and traded three notches tighter at 277 b.p. when the bond was freed to trade, dealers said.
There were also sales to retail investors in Continental Europe -- Germany, Italy and Switzerland -- who were attracted by the 10.0 percent coupon.
Argentina's debut sterling-denominated five-year Eurobond was priced to yield 390 b.p. over gilts last July and has since tightened to trade around 210 b.p, dealers said.
